page.title: 13CHURCHES-DUNTON GREEN AREA
page.content: Churches in our area are the Free Church, St. John the Divine, & a small chapel in Dunton Green, & St. Mary's at Riverhead. The Free Church was built in 1932 and is used a lot by bodies such as Scouts and Girls' Brigade. Riverhead & D.G. formerly 2 church communities, are now one parish and St. John's, built in 1890 with a Â£500 contribution from Samuel Wreford, from a family of silk merchants, is closed now & local worshippers share the use of the Free Church. At Riverhead some 200 attend service & an area is being made in the church for daytime use. Lord Amherst's family are buried in the churchyard. At Chevening,St.Botolph's church is old and has always been associated with Chevening Estate
